attributes.action: Public Vote to decided to have a Coaltion Government
attributes.additional_details:
On the voting card for a general election it should also be asked of the voter whether in the event of a hung parliament if they wish for a government to be formed by way of a coalition or not.

This would ensure that ordinary citizen’s right to a free and democratic vote is continued in the event of a hung parliament.

In the event the majority agree to a coalition and a hung parliament exists then parties may explore the possibility of forming a coalition government, however in the event that the majority do not agree then either a recount or a further general election should be called.
